caption:
This photograph depicts a construction site in a desert environment. In the foreground, a prominent sign features safety messaging. The text on the sign, "A DAA a da hwil yaa doo OUR WORK IS NEVER SO URGENT OR IMPORTANT THAT WE CANNOT TAKE TIME TO DO IT SAFELY. - BECHTEL", is written in both Navajo and English, indicating awareness of cultural inclusivity. The sign also includes an illustration of a man, likely intended to represent a worker, emphasizing the safety theme.

The background is busy with industrial activity, showcasing several large structures under construction, including scaffolding, a tall smokestack, and possibly a power plant or industrial facility. Several cranes and other construction equipment are visible, used for heavy lifting and building. The environment is vast and open, with a clear sky and flat, arid terrain enhancing the industrial feel of the scene.

The image captures both the scale of the industrial project and the emphasis on safety in such environments, underlined by the multilingual safety sign in the forefront.
title: Navajo generating plant under construction. Occupying over a thousand acres leased from the Navajo Indians. The plant will be the largest electric generating station in Arizona.
